creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: 4-part sculpture composed of long, black leaf like forms highlighted with red pigment, eminating from base like a fountain when assembled
image_copyright: © Kofushiwaki Tsukasa %2F licensed by Minneapolis Institute of Art
text: Using his bare hands instead of a mold, Kofushiwaki spent about a month creating this freestanding sculpture. In order to support the object, he used a heavy boulder as the base, thus suggesting that the foundation is like the roots of a tree. The title indicates that each side of the monumental foliage has a distinct appearance.
title: A Leaf, so It Has a Back and Front
